بسم اللّه الرّحمن الرّحيم
صلوات اللّه وبركاته ونوامي زكواته وأفضل تحيّاته على مولانا وسيّدنا الإمام المستنصر باللّه
أمير المومپپن صلوات اللّه عليه وعلى آبائه الطّاهرين وعلى أبنائه الأكرمين عبد مولانا صلوات الله عليه يستجير مستجير بالله
تعالى ذكره وبعدل الدّولة النّبويّة وذلك أن كان له ولد رجل عمره ست ثلث وعشرين سنة سافر
من سرسنا في سميريّة هو ورجل تاجر معه شاب أيضا عمره ست ثلث وعشرين سنة أيضا
وفي وسطهما مال عين قدره خمس مائة دينارا وبضاعة معهم قدرها مائة مائتان دينار
يطلبوا بلد فوّة ليدخلا إلى إسكندريّة سكندريّة فغدر بهما رئيس ريّس السّميريّة والنّواتية
الّذين اللّتي الّذي فيها وقتلا الشّابين الرّجلين المذكورين وأخذوا ما كان معهم
من المال والبضاعة وعبد مولانا صلّى اللّه عليه مستجير باللّه تعالى ذكره
وبعدل الدّولة النّبويّة ثبّت اللّه أركانها يسئل يسل التّوقيع إلي
خلفا الأمير الموفّق سنان الدّولة بالقبض على هولا النّواتية ورئيس وريّس السّميريّة وكشف
هذا الحال كشف يعلم منه صحّة ما ذكره العبد ولمولانا
صلّى اللّه عليه عالي الرّأي في ذلك إن شا اللّه

In the name of God, the merciful and compassionate. In the name of God, the Merciful, the Compassionate.
The benedictions of God and his blessings, his increasing benefactions and most excellent greetings be upon our master and lord the 'imām al-Mustanṣir bi-Allāh, The blessings and benedictions of God, and His increasing benefactions and most excellent greetings be upon our Lord and Master the Imām al-Mustanṣir billāh,
Commander of the Faithful, God's blessings upon him, his pure ancestors and noble sons. The slave of our Lord, God's blessings be upon him, seeks refuge with God commander of the faithful, the blessings of God be upon him and upon his pure ancestors and most noble sons. The slave of my master, the blessings of God be upon him, takes refuge in God,
(may His name be blessed) and the justice of the prophetic dynasty, in the following matter. He had a son, a young man twenty-six years old, who was travelling of exalted name, and in the justice of the prophetic dynasty, on account of the following: He had a son, a man of twenty-three years of age, who travelled
from Sirsinā in a boat, together with a merchant, a young man who was also twenty-three years old. from Sirsinā in a boat, together with another merchant, also a young man twenty-six years old.
They carried in partnership five-hundred dīnārs in cash and goods worth two-hundred dīnārs. They carried in their belt 500 dinars in cash and had with them merchandise to the value of 100 dinars.
Their destination was the town of Fuwwa, from which they proposed to continue their journey to Alexandria. The captain of the boat, however, and the sailors on board treacherously They were making for the town of Fuwwa and, from there, to Alexandria. The captain of the boat and the sailors
in it betrayed the two aforementioned young men, killed them and took murdered the said young men and took their
money and merchandise. The slave of our Lord, God's blessing upon him, seeks refuge with God (may His name be exalted) the money and the goods that they were carrying. The slave of our master, God bless him, taking refuge in God, of exalted name,
and in the justice of the prophetic dynasty, may God establish its supports, asks for a rescript to be issued to and with the justice of the prophetic dynasty (may God firmly establish its pillars) and petitions for an order to be issued to the
lieutenants of the Prosperous Amīr Sinān al-Dawla to arrest those sailors and the captain of the boat and investigate the lieutenants of the prosperous 'amīr, Sinān al-Dawla, to arrest those sailors and the captain of the boat and to investigate
the matter, so that the truth of the slave's account be confirmed. To our Lord, this case, so that the truthfulness of what the slave has said to be known. To our master
God bless him, belongs the exalted resolution in this matter, if God wills. God's blessing upon him, belongs the exalted opinion in this matter, if God wills.
